intro: Gossia macilwraithensis, commonly known as the Macilwraith's gossia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture typical of many myrtle family members. Gossia macilwraithensis is a rare species, found only in a few isolated locations within Queensland.
